executable.title: Volumes
executable.description: This module is used for changing the appearance of various volume types.
executable.contributor: Steve Pieper (Isomics), Julien Finet (Kitware), Alex Yarmarkovich (Isomics), Nicole Aucoin (SPL, BWH)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the National Alliance for Medical Image Computing (NAMIC), funded by the National Institutes of Health through the NIH Roadmap for Medical Research, Grant U54 EB005149.

parameters.label: Active Volume
parameters.description: Select the volume to display and operate on -- the module's Display interface will change to show controls appropriate for the volume type.

parameters.label: Volume Information
parameters.description: Information about the selected volume. Some fields can be edited to correctly describe, for example, when loading incompletely specified image data such as a sequence of jpeg files. Use caution however, since changing properties such as Image Spacing will impact the physical accuracy of some calculations such as Label Statistics.

parameter.label: Image Dimensions
parameter.description: The number of pixels in "IJK" space - this is the way the data is arranged in memory. The IJK indices (displayed in the DataProbe) go from 0 to dimension-1 in each direction.

parameter.label: Image Spacing
parameter.description: The physical distance between pixel centers when mapped to patient space expressed in millimeters.

parameter.label: Image Origin
parameter.description: The location of the center of the 0,0,0 (IJK) pixel expressed with respect to patient space. Patient space is organized with respect to the subject's Right, Anterior, and Superior anatomical directions. See http://www.slicer.org/slicerWiki/index.php/Coordinate_systems for more information.

parameter.label: Center Volume
parameter.description: This button will adjust the Image Origin so that the entire volume is centered around 0,0,0 in patient space.

parameter.label: Scan Order
parameter.description: Describes the image orientation (how the IJK space is oriented with respect to patient RAS.

parameter.label: Number of Scalars
parameter.description: Most CT or MR scans have one scalar component (grayscale). Color images have three components (red, green, blue). Tensor images have 9 components. For diffusion weighted volumes this indicates the number of baseline and gradient volumes.

parameter.label: Scalars Type
parameter.description: Tells the computer representation of each pixel. Most operations work independent of scalar type. Label map volumes must be of type Short for use with the Editor module.

parameter.label: Filename
parameter.description: Path to the file which this volume was loaded from/saved to

parameter.label: LabelMap
parameter.description: Indicates and controls if the Volume is a label map

parameter.label: Window/Level Presets
parameter.description: Loaded from DICOM headers defined by scanner or by technician.

parameters.label: Display
parameters.description: Set of visualization controls appropriate for the currently selected volume. Not all controls are available for all volume types.

parameter.label: Lookup Table
parameter.description: Select the color mapping for scalar volumes to colors.

parameter.label: Interpolate
parameter.description: When checked, slice views will display linearly interpolated slices through input volumes. Unchecked indicates nearest neighbor resampling

parameter.label: Window Level Presets
parameter.description: Predefinied shortcuts to window/level and color table combinations for common visualization requirements.

parameter.label: Window/Level Controls
parameter.description: Double slider with text input to define the range of input volume data that should be mapped to the display grayscale. Auto window level tries to estimate the intensity range of the foreground image data. On mouse over, a popup slides down to add support for large dynamic range by giving control over the range of the window level double slider.

parameter.label: Threshold
parameter.description: Controls the range of the image that should be considered transparent when used in the foreground layer of the slice display. Same parameters also control transparency of slice models displayed in the 3D viewers.

parameter.label: Histogram
parameter.description: Shows the number of pixels (y axis) vs the image intensity (x axis) over a background of the current window/level and threshold mapping.

parameters.label: Diffusion Weighted Volumes
parameters.description: The following controls show up when a DWI volume is selected

parameter.label: DWI Component
parameter.description: Selects the baseline or diffusion gradient direction volume to display.

parameters.label: Diffusion Tensor Volumes
parameters.description: The following controls show up when a DTI volume is selected

parameter.label: Scalar Mode
parameter.description: Mapping from tensor to scalar.

parameter.label: Glyphs on Slices Display
parameter.description: Allows display of graphics visualizations of tensors on one or more of the standard Red, Green, or Yellow slice views.

parameter.label: Opacity
parameter.description: How much of the underlying image shows through the glyphs.

parameter.label: Scalar Color Map
parameter.description: How scalar measures of tensor are mapped to color.

parameter.label: Color by Scalar
parameter.description: Which scalar metric is used to determine the color of the glyphs.

parameter.label: Scalar Range
parameter.description: Defines the min-max range of the scalar mapping to color. When enabled, allows a consistent color mapping independent of the full range of the currently displayed item (if not selected color range will cover min-max of the currently displayed data).

parameter.label: Glyph Type
parameter.description: Tubes and line show direction of eigen vector of tensor (major, middle, or minimum as selected by the Glyph Eigenvector parameter). Ellipsoid shows direction and relative scale of all three eigenvectors.

parameter.label: Scale Factor
parameter.description: Controls size of glyphs. There are no physical units for this parameter.

parameter.label: Spacing
parameter.description: Controls the number of glyphs on the slice view.

parameter.label: Glyph Eigenvector
parameter.description: Selects which aspect of tensor controls orientation of glyphs.
